Posts.Content: 9 days post op, and cancer free. I've up dated signature with biopsy results, and i am ecstatic. A couple of thoughts: i went in dehydrated due to not drinking water with the bowel prep, and it added about a day for my liver to start functioning properly. Also, pay close attention to eating really small, very bland meals for a good while following surgery. When i ate too much too soon and with the addition of hospital drugs, it gave me all kinds of digestive gas problems that felt much like a heart attack. I do not relax very well and remained tense uncontrollably. Everything seems to be working pretty well now. i have a fair amount of continence, and began Kegels on 4th day. Complete continence will take some time. I tend not to be a fast healer. Drs. cleared me for Viagra and vacuum device, however my BP remains low following surgery and i will continue taking heart meds. So for a time i will monitor before adding the 3 times a week viagra. So, we were going for the triple play, Cancer free: done, Continence: statistical probability high, and sexual function, same. Drs. don't want me in my pool for 5 weeks, and they don't want me to repair my torn meniscus of the left knee for the same period, so walks are going to be a challenge to balance mileage vs: swelling.
Posts.Signature: 70 y/o male, lung cancer at 49 y/o, upper lobectomy + radiation, adenocarcenoma non small cell T2-N1-M0 lymph node involvement, CA free 20+years. BPH 6 yrs+,DRE unspectacular, PSA progress: 5/12:1.9,5/13:2.5,11/14:3.2,2/15:3.8 Father had early brachytherapy. My biopsy: 4/15 Gleason 3+4=7, 4 of 12 quads. 5% to 50% robotic radical prostatectomy Dr. Vipul Patel @ global robotics institute DaVinci 6/25/15 patho results 6/25/15rostate gland w/seminal vesicles & vasa deferenta high grade PIN AJCC stage pT2c Gleason 3+4=7 10% of gland, neg surgical margins LN not sub. seminal vesicle invasion not id,wt.43gm, 8/16 PSA <0.1 all systems operational. 3 yr older brother diag PCA 10/16. 14 mo older brother elev PSA.
Posts.Title: Beat lung cancer now get to beat prostate cancer

Posts.Content: Scheduled for robotic radial prostatectomy at the Florida Hospital, Center for Urologic Cancer. Have a date with the DaVinci & Dr. Vipul Patel and team. I am looking forward to winning this battle and getting back to golf. Can I get a word of encouragement?

Posts.Title: Beat lung cancer now get to beat prostate cancer

Posts.Content: 6 weeks post op today. PSA <0.1 surgeon says drop the pads when at home. 150 Kegels daily and 2 mile walks are working well. Add 20 squats per day to regimen. Continue with vacume device and Viagra thrice weekly. PSA every 3 mos for a year. Time to dust off the golf clubs.
